channel.title: Need help with editing messages etc
channel.description:
i need help with 2 things.. 1. how can i edit the message it sends whenever you log in? (type in ::starter to get started, visit the forums at blah, etc.) 2. how can i edit the words inside the quest box?
thx
:P~Zeph~:P

item.title: Need help with editing messages etc
item.dc:creator: @pwnedurmom pwnedurmom
item.description:
@pwnedurmom wrote:

fuck off loser all i said was that, his way was incorrect your the fucking dick around here read your own fucking posts once in a while k?

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with editing messages etc

item.title: Need help with editing messages etc
item.dc:creator: @guitars595 guitars595
item.description:
@guitars595 wrote:

[quote=“pwnedurmom, post:7, topic:222622”][quote author=guitars595 link=topic=292400.msg2354814#msg2354814 date=1217261739]
Okay for the quest one go into your Texthandler file, should be at the bottom of the source file, and search what you see in your quest log. If you find the text you can change there. And for when you log in thing search in Client.java for like starter or Welcome to… and change it if you find it
[/quote]

fail. for the quests we will still be in your client.java

so now we search for basicly

sendQuest("", 7383);

now if you can’t find anything for this search this

sendQuest("

search till you see somthing like you see in your quest list on your server when your logged in

now, you can edit messages already in there but to add more just scroll down through the
empty (""), ####);
and fill in your message between the two ", NOTE, it’s not used for long text 3 words max.

To get ride of the Quests already in your Quest book,eg… the red ones near the bottom

hover your mouse over them and in the left top hand corner of your screen you should see some numbers, go back to the list of message and add this

sendQuest(""), #####);

ok so the numbers you have, replaces the #'s with thos numbers and that quest disapears

hope this helped.

[/quote]
I fucking hate the attitude of the people on this forum. You don’t have to be a dick all the time.

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with editing messages etc

item.title: Need help with editing messages etc
item.dc:creator: @zepher793 zepher793
item.description:
@zepher793 wrote:

[quote=“pwnedurmom, post:7, topic:222622”][quote author=guitars595 link=topic=292400.msg2354814#msg2354814 date=1217261739]
Okay for the quest one go into your Texthandler file, should be at the bottom of the source file, and search what you see in your quest log. If you find the text you can change there. And for when you log in thing search in Client.java for like starter or Welcome to… and change it if you find it
[/quote]

fail. for the quests we will still be in your client.java

so now we search for basicly

sendQuest("", 7383);

now if you can’t find anything for this search this

sendQuest("

search till you see somthing like you see in your quest list on your server when your logged in

now, you can edit messages already in there but to add more just scroll down through the
empty (""), ####);
and fill in your message between the two ", NOTE, it’s not used for long text 3 words max.

To get ride of the Quests already in your Quest book,eg… the red ones near the bottom

hover your mouse over them and in the left top hand corner of your screen you should see some numbers, go back to the list of message and add this

sendQuest(""), #####);

ok so the numbers you have, replaces the #'s with thos numbers and that quest disapears

hope this helped.

[/quote]
thx, and yes, that helped =]

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with editing messages etc
item.dc:creator: @pwnedurmom pwnedurmom
item.description:
@pwnedurmom wrote:

guitars595:

Okay for the quest one go into your Texthandler file, should be at the bottom of the source file, and search what you see in your quest log. If you find the text you can change there. And for when you log in thing search in Client.java for like starter or Welcome to… and change it if you find it

fail. for the quests we will still be in your client.java

so now we search for basicly

sendQuest("", 7383);

now if you can’t find anything for this search this

sendQuest("

search till you see somthing like you see in your quest list on your server when your logged in

now, you can edit messages already in there but to add more just scroll down through the
empty (""), ####);
and fill in your message between the two ", NOTE, it’s not used for long text 3 words max.

To get ride of the Quests already in your Quest book,eg… the red ones near the bottom

hover your mouse over them and in the left top hand corner of your screen you should see some numbers, go back to the list of message and add this

sendQuest(""), #####);

ok so the numbers you have, replaces the #'s with thos numbers and that quest disapears

hope this helped.
